Information Architecture (IA)

The Digital Experience and Product Office (DEPO) platform team maintains the information architecture of VA.gov , including all navigation structures, URL logic, naming conventions for labels, guidance on taxonomies, and general user flows.

What the DEPO platform provides

To maintain the information architecture, the DEPO platform provides the following services:

  • Reviews of information architecture for new applications and features, new templates on VA.gov , updates to the global navigation design and experience, and user research performed on VA.gov that will result in information architecture changes
  • Validation of URL changes requested by VFS (Veteran Facing Services) teams, URL redirects, and vanity URLs

  • Documentation and guidance regarding VA.gov information architecture best practices The DEPO platform team collaborates with VFS teams and DEPO leadership on evaluations and audits of the overall information architecture health of VA.gov . This ensures that information remains easy to find for people visiting VA.gov , and information places displays appropriately and accurately in search engine results. The Content Management System (CMS) team (part of the DEPO platform) is responsible for making updates to the global navigation elements that are rendered as part of the Drupal content management system. VFS teams should work directly with the CMS team to implement any changes after their information architecture has been approved by the DEPO platform information architecture team. 

    VFS team responsibilities

    When developing new applications and functionality on VA.gov , VFS teams have the following responsibilities:

  • Provide the DEPO platform with sufficient information to determine appropriate location of their work within the larger information architecture of VA.gov
  • Apply of information architecture best practices as per DEPO platform documentation

  • Request validation of any desired URL redirects
